content.title: Intro
content.content: -llo is an ablative Quenya ending meaning "from" or "out of".[1]:72

content.title: Examples
content.content:
Sindanóriello = "out of a grey land" [1][2]
Rómello "those from the East"[1]:74
Eärello = "out of the Great Sea"[1]:103[3]

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 J.R.R. Tolkien, "Words, Phrases and Passages in Various Tongues in The Lord of the Rings", in Parma Eldalamberon XVII (edited by Christopher Gilson)
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, Donald Swann, The Road Goes Ever On, "Namárië (Farewell)", pp. 58-59
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, The Return of the King, "The Steward and the King", Elendil's Oath
